intro: Scutellaria glabra, commonly known as smooth blueweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves and spikes of small, tubular blue or purple flowers. Scutellaria glabra is often found in moist soils along stream banks and in shaded woodlands. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
